content:
Yes! Here are some recommendations for online study groups or communities for the GMAT:

1. GMAT Club: GMAT Club is an online platform where you can get discussion forums, study materials, and resources to help you prepare for the GMAT. You can join their online study groups and interact with other GMAT test-takers. 2. Beat the GMAT: Beat the GMAT is another online community that caters to GMAT test-takers. You can find study partners, seek advice, and get access to study materials to help you prepare for the exam. 3. Manhattan Prep GMAT Forums: Manhattan Prep is a well-known GMAT test prep provider. They have an active online community where you can find study resources and connect with other test-takers. 4. Kaplan GMAT Community: Kaplan is another popular GMAT test prep provider with a thriving online community. You can participate in forum discussions, find study partners, and access study resources to prepare for the GMAT. 5. Veritas Prep Blogs and Forums: Veritas Prep is a leading test prep provider for the GMAT. They have an active blog and forum community where you can find study tips, resources, and engage with other GMAT test-takers. These are just a few examples, but there are many other online study groups or communities available. You can also consider creating your own study group with friends or colleagues who are also preparing for the GMAT. Good luck!
